jd_content:
Software Engineer | Founding Team Early-Stage Startup | $5M+ Raised

Hi Eduardo,

I have partnered with a fast-growing startup developing a cutting-edge Agentic AI layer for business applications.

The organization is VC-backed and have recently closed a $5M+ round of funding in just 5 days.

They are seeking to hire experienced Software Engineers, who will be a founding member of the engineering team & will play a pivotal role contributing to the development of their agentic AI model.

My client's product is a LLM-based application and they are looking for full-stack SW Engineers with the following tech stack experience: Python, TypeScript, React, and Postgres. Their key libraries are FastAPI, Pydantic, and LangGraph.

I am reaching out to you as I am confident your experience at Labrynth aligns with their expectations & meets their exceptional performance indicators that they use to identify & hire top-talent.

This will be an on-site role in Oslo. With regards to compensation they offer attractive salaries competitive with FAANG companies.

If this is of interest, when might we speak & what is the best number to contact you on?

Scarlett Robinson
BD Executive | Metric Geo | AI & Generative AI
notes: Oslo, Norway. Agentic AI startup via Metric Geo recruiter (Scarlett Robinson). Interview scheduled Jan 2nd. VC-backed, M+ raised.

jd_content:
Python Developer (GenAI) - EPAM Systems

Position: Python Developer (GenAI)
Company: EPAM Systems
Location: Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland
Seniority Level: Mid-Senior
Employment Type: Full-time

Overview:
EPAM seeks a GenAI specialist to join their banking sector team, focusing on enhancing application UI/UX with ReactJS and integrating ChatGPT/OpenAI solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design and implement use cases leveraging AI/ML and GenAI technologies
- Set up and manage Azure environments for building and deploying AI/ML solutions
- Deliver features end-to-end with high-quality implementation
- Participate in architectural decision-making
- Engage with business stakeholders on deliverables and feedback

Core Requirements:
- 5+ years IT experience with production-grade Python expertise
- REST API development using Flask, Django or FastAPI
- LangGraph ecosystem familiarity
- Deep Learning theory, language models, and transformer understanding
- LLM fundamentals knowledge: Prompting, RAG, Function Calling, Agentic Workflows
- Minimum 1 year delivering end-to-end GenAI agentic solutions
- GenAI solution performance optimization ability
- Docker and Git experience

Preferred Qualifications:
- ReactJS or Angular exposure
- RDBMS understanding
- Azure or public cloud exposure

Benefits:
5 weeks vacation, stock purchase plan, enhanced parental leave, extended pension, daily sickness allowance, employee assistance, global travel insurance, and 22,000+ LinkedIn Learning courses.

Eligibility:
Swiss nationals, EU/EFTA nationals, third-country nationals with work permits, or displaced Ukrainians with S permits.
notes: Zurich, Switzerland. Banking sector, GenAI/LLM focus.

jd_content:
Senior AI Engineer Position at ZEVEN

Job Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer (Senior level)
Company: ZEVEN
Location: Zurich, Switzerland
Employment Type: Full-time

Company Overview:
ZEVEN is a newly-founded startup focused on revolutionizing sports through AI-powered solutions. The team aims to unlock human potential and redefine the sports experience through innovation.

Key Responsibilities:
- Lead design and development of AI/ML systems emphasizing quality and maintainability
- Convert research prototypes into production-ready solutions and pipelines
- Handle complex datasets including geospatial, sensor, and time-series information
- Optimize system performance, efficiency, and scalability
- Ensure testing rigor, reproducibility, and thorough documentation
- Mentor junior team members and establish MLOps best practices
- Stay current with AI engineering trends and integrate innovations

Required Qualifications:

Experience:
- 5+ years in AI engineering, machine learning development, or applied ML roles

Technical Skills:
- Full ML lifecycle expertise (MLOps)
- Cloud infrastructure proficiency, preferably AWS with serverless computing and GPU clusters
- Python proficiency for AI/ML development and deployment
- Knowledge of agentic AI systems, LLMs, foundation models, inference, fine-tuning, RAG, and prompt engineering
- Ability to evaluate AI methods for practical performance and reliability
- Proficiency with frameworks like LangChain, MCP, Hugging Face, and LLM APIs

Desired Qualities:
- Strong problem-solving and debugging capabilities
- Excellent communication and cross-functional collaboration skills
- Attention to detail and quality focus
- Accountability and ownership mindset
- Creative, open thinking approach

Nice-to-Have Qualifications:
- Open-source AI/ML contributions
- Experience guiding AI/ML projects or teams
- Background with sports, human movement, or performance data
- Prior collaboration with research, web, and product teams

What ZEVEN Offers:
- Competitive salary with benefits package including stock options, pension plan bonus, 25 vacation days plus holidays
- Flexible hybrid work arrangement
- Company outings and sports events
- Equipment: MacBook Pro laptops, standing desks
- Office location near Zurich lake with public transport access and full kitchen facilities
- Early-stage equity compensation
- Opportunity to impact products reaching millions of users

Team Culture:
The company values genuine passion for outdoor sports. Team members speak multiple languages (German, Basque, French, Spanish) with English as the primary workplace language.
notes: Zurich, Switzerland. Sports AI startup. Cover letter included personal sports background (tennis, climbing, sailing, skate, surf, kitesurf) and N=1 experiment philosophy.

jd_content:
At Caffeine.ai, we are building the world's first platform to create full-stack, on-chain applications through natural language. Our mission is to make building software as simple as a conversation - transforming ideas into live applications instantly. 
We are a cross-functional team of engineers and researchers building the AI that powers this new paradigm. To do this, we need world-class product engineers who can design beautiful, reliable, and performant experiences across the stack.

About the Role

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to help build the next generation of our agentic AI system. You'll work directly on the intelligence behind specification generation, dependency planning, backend & frontend code generation, error-repair loops, E2E evaluation, dataset quality, and model integrations.

You will play a key role in designing and evolving an agent-based architecture for app creation - enabling modularity, versioning, observability, and continuous improvement across all stages of the pipeline, from user intent to deployed application.

You'll be joining the AI team and collaborate across teams to ship reliable, scalable, and innovative AI features into production.

What You'll Do

- Contribute to the design and implementation of multi-agent LLM architectures that power Caffeine's full-stack code generation pipeline.
- Build and maintain training datasets, including synthetic generation, filtering, validation, and alignment mechanisms.
- Develop post-training and fine-tuning pipelines (SFT, RLHF/RLVR, preference modeling) to improve reasoning, reliability, and code quality.
- Design and extend evaluation harnesses, including error-reproduction, regression detection, benchmarks, and E2E AI-generated app evaluations.
- Implement and refine RAG / context engineering pipelines to provide the right context for each agent stage.
- Collaborate with the Integration, App, SRE, and Infra teams to ensure reliability, observability, and maintainability of the AI system in production.
- Participate in rapid experimentation, benchmarking, ablations, and architectural improvements.

Who You Are

- Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, or a related field.
- Experience with full-stack TypeScript (e.g., React/Next.js, Node.js/NestJS/Fastify) and monorepo tooling (e.g., pnpm, Turborepo)
- Experience training, fine-tuning, or evaluating LLMs (SFT, RLHF, RAG, or similar).
- Experience with LLM-based code generation, compilers, or static analysis.
- Comfortable working in a TypeScript-heavy product codebase and enjoy the intersection of ML and software engineering.
- Comfortable working in fast-moving, highly technical environments.
- Background in multi-agent architectures or structured reasoning.

Bonus

- Publications or prior work involving LLMs, agents, program synthesis, or automated code generation.
- Experience with large-scale training pipelines (e.g., distributed training, DeepSpeed).
- Strong interest in designing modular, versioned agentic systems.
- Experience with prompt engineering for complex multi-step workflows.

*This is a hybrid role based in our Zurich office, with a requirement of 3+ days in the office per week.
notes: Zurich, Switzerland (hybrid 3+ days). Multi-agent LLM architectures, code generation. Rejected.

jd_content:
Senior AI Engineer - ELCA Group

Company: ELCA Group
Location: Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland
Employment Type: Full-time
Job Function: Engineering and Information Technology
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting

Role Overview:
This position requires leading comprehensive artificial intelligence and data science initiatives, transitioning complex business problems into scalable, production-ready systems.

Key Responsibilities:
- Oversee end-to-end AI/ML projects from initial analysis to solution delivery
- Examine and construct machine learning models addressing real-world business needs
- Create dependable data pipelines transforming raw data into high-quality training inputs
- Design and maintain MLOps systems for automated training, deployment, and monitoring
- Mentor junior data scientists and establish technical best practices
- Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams across IT, engineering, and business functions
- Present insights to both technical and non-technical audiences

Required Qualifications:
- 5+ years in AI, data science, or machine learning engineering
- University degree in technical field
- Strong Python programming with modern ML frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
- Solid grasp of data analysis, MLOps, and production-grade ML systems
- Software engineering fundamentals knowledge (Linux/Windows, Git, APIs, data storage)
- Analytical mindset with autonomous problem-solving abilities
- Fluency in French and English
- Willingness to travel within Romandie region

Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience with cloud platforms and big data technologies

What ELCA Group Offers:
- Collaborative, skilled professional environment
- Meaningful projects using contemporary AI technologies
- Flat organizational structures
- Direct customer exposure across diverse industries
- Strong professional development opportunities
notes: Lausanne, Switzerland. Addressed French language gap in cover letter - candidate has English, Portuguese, Spanish but not French.
